channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weeds overgrown, 4th July
item.description:
The pavements all along Mauritius Road are overgrown with weeds. This is difficult for those in wheelchairs, those not able bodied, or those pushing prams to walk down. They are also a trip hazard for young children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mauritius Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Graffiti in several locations, 4th July
item.description:
Please could you remove the graffiti here, on the facade of Santander bank and also on the new block of apartments above Iceland. It looks really ugly, and I hope that part of the Â£24m of levelling-up funding could be allocated to removing this, as it makes a terrible impression for locals and visitors alike. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-11, Albion Way, Hither Green, Lewisham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public trees obstructing pavement and road., 4th July
item.description:
The basal growth and low hanging branches on trees the length of Ridgeway Drive have not been cut back in over a year. The pavements are obstructed for pedestrians and branches are striking vehicles in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridgeway Drive, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
